text: Margaret Hull (born 23 June 1902) was a British track and field athlete during the 1920s, the early era of women's athletics. She was specialized in the long jump and also competed in sprint events (100 metres, 200 metres). Hull represents Great Britain at international competitions. In 1925 she won the silver medal at the WAAA championships in the long jump behind Hilda Hatt, with a distance of 4.77 meters. Later the year she represented Great Britain at the 1925 Great Britain–Czechoslovakia–Canada women's athletics match on 1 August. In the long jump she jumped 5.15 meters and was that year a top-10 best performances of 1925 worldwide. At the WAAA championships in 1926 she jumped 4.81 and finished third behind Phyllis Green and Josephine Matthews. She was selected as a member of the British team at the 1926 Women's World Games. ==References== ==Other websites== * Image of the British team at the 1926 Women's World Games Category:1902 births Category:British sprinters Category:British long jumpers Category:Year of death missing
title: Margaret Hull
